newsitem.title: UK: UK firms capital expenditure fell 4.0% in Q2.
newsitem.headline: UK firms capital expenditure fell 4.0% in Q2.

text.p: UK manufacturers' spending on capital assets, including leased assets, fell by a provisional seasonally adjusted 4.0 pct in the second quarter of 1996 over the first quarter, data from the Office for National Statistics showed.
Manufacturers' expenditure was 2.990 billion stg in the second quarter, compared with 3.117 billion in Q1.
Capital expenditure was five percent lower than in the second quarter of 1995.
The provisional estimates of capital expenditure for other production fell by 10 percent, while services rose by 7.0 percent and construction rose 21 percent over the previous quarter, the ONS said.
